title: Ticket #4431: Poor error message from condor_ping
description:
We had a user report the following issue: 

#  condor_ce_ping -pool 'osg-gw-4.t2.ucsd.edu' -name 'osg-gw-4.t2.ucsd.edu' -table READ WRITE DAEMON
ERROR: couldn't locate osg-gw-4.t2.ucsd.edu!

This made him think the schedd was not reporting. However, if you add the "-debug" flag, you got: 

$ condor_ce_ping -debug -pool osg-gw-4.t2.ucsd.edu -name osg-gw-4.t2.ucsd.edu
WARNING: Missing <authz-level | command-name | command-int> argument, defaulting to DC_NOP
06/30/14 20:44:12 recognized DC_NOP as command name, using command 60011.
06/30/14 20:44:12 attempt to connect to <169.228.130.18:9618> failed: No route to host (connect errno = 113).
ERROR: couldn't locate osg-gw-4.t2.ucsd.edu!

This makes it clear there is a issue contacting the collector.

Can the error message be improved? The condor_status client handled this error well.
creator: bbockelm
